intro: Carex oligantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedges, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist to wet environments, such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves that are usually less than 1 inch wide, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typically found in clusters at the tips of the stems. Carex oligantha plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various organisms.
